April 8, 1931.

37th Street, north side, east from Second Avenue.

P. L. Sperr.

P. L. Sperr.

The same.

247-221 East 37th Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Second Avenue, showing the Murray Hill Vocational School at No. 247 on the corner and Public School No. 49 at No. 237 adjoining it.

April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
37th Street, east from No. 231, north side, between Third and Second Avenues, showing Public School No. 49 at No. 237.
April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, east from No. 226, south side, between Third and Second Avenues. The church spire beyond Second Avenue is that of St. Gabriel's at No. 308.
April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
37th Street, east from No. 231, north side, between Third and Second Avenues, showing Public School No. 49 at No. 237.
April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, east from No. 226, south side, between Third and Second Avenues. The church spire beyond Second Avenue is that of St. Gabriel's at No. 308.
April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Second Avenue, east side, between East 36th and 37th Street's and viewing eastward toward First Avenue, to show there the entrance to the Midtown-Queens Tunnel. The buildings in the background are on the east side of the Avenue, while those appearing on the left are on the north side of East 37th Street.

September 21, 1940
No's. 1-2

P. L. Sperr

The same, from another angle.

P. L. Sperr

October 11, 1939

Second Avenue, east side, north from E. 37th Street and showing a clearance at the N. E. corner of same. The 16 story apartment house in the center is No 301 E. 38th Street, erected 1928.

January 9, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

677 Second Avenue, west side, between E. 36th and 37th Streets. June of this year will find this and the adjoining structures non-existant, having been demolished for tunnel construction.

January 17, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

Second Avenue, west side, south from E. 38th to 37th Streets.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

Second Avenue, west side, from E. 37th to 38th Streets. These buildings bear No's 685 to 705 inclusive.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

East 37th Street, at Second Avenue, as photographed across the plaza entrance to the Queens-Midtown Tunnel. This is south of the street; the buildings being on the north side of same. The "El" line is upon the Avenue. In the background are the skyscrapers constituting the 42nd Street-Grand Central zone. The photographer is viewing northwestward from East 36th Street, and is standing almost on the site of the former St. Gabriels R. C. Church and School.

October 11, 1939
September 21, 1940

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, at Second Avenue, as photographed across the plaza entrance to the Queens-Midtown Tunnel. This is south of the street; the buildings being on the north side of same. The "El" line is upon the Avenue. In the background are the skyscrapers constituting the 42nd Street-Grand Central zone. The photographer is viewing northwestward from East 36th Street, and is standing almost on the site of the former St. Gabriels R. C. Church and School.

October 11, 1939
September 21, 1940

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, north side, west towards Second Avenue, showing the structures that face the new plaza entrance to the Queens-Midtown Tunnel. The open space separating the foreground buildings is to be the new roadway from same to 42nd Street.

May 26, 1939
Sept. 21, 1940

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, north side, west towards Second Avenue, showing the structures that face the new plaza entrance to the Queens-Midtown Tunnel. The open space separating the foreground buildings is to be the new roadway from same to 42nd Street.

May 26, 1939
Sept. 21, 1940

P. L. Sperr

E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing at No. 308, St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church prior to demolition (June 1939) as a portion of the clearance necessitated for the approach to the 38th Street tunnel. The lower portion of this block is already razed and the balance will shortly follow.

January 8, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

East 37th Street, east of Second Avenue, showing mainly the partially demolished St. Gabriel's Church and parish house.

The operator is photographing same across a clearance at the N.E. corner. The tenements appearing at the left will not be razed. They remain to face the plaza approach of the Midtown - Queens tunnel.

May 26, 1939
Views: 1-2

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, east of Second Avenue, showing mainly the partially demolished St. Gabriel's Church and parish house.

The operator is photographing same across a clearance at the N.E. corner. The tenements appearing at the left will not be razed. They remain to face the plaza approach of the Midtown - Queens tunnel.

May 26, 1939
Views: 1-2

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, east from Second Avenue. The buildings on the right will be demolished for the Midtown Queens tunnel. This phase completed is shown in Views 2 and 3.

Note at the left the clearance at the N.E. corner. This preceded the tunnel project and had nothing to do with same. The New York Steam Co. plant appears on 35th Street, between First Avenue and the East River.

Demolition of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church permitted this view and the steeple-less edifice is seen (in View 1) slightly to the east of Second Avenue.

View 1: May 26, 1939
Views 2-3: June 28, 1939

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, east from Second Avenue. The buildings on the right will be demolished for the Midtown Queens tunnel. This phase completed is shown in Views 2 and 3.

Note at the left the clearance at the N.E. corner. This preceded the tunnel project and had nothing to do with same. The New York Steam Co. plant appears on 35th Street, between First Avenue and the East River.

Demolition of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church permitted this view and the steeple-less edifice is seen (in View 1) slightly to the east of Second Avenue.

View 1: May 26, 1939
Views 2-3: June 28, 1939

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, east from Second Avenue. The buildings on the right will be demolished for the Midtown Queens tunnel. This phase completed is shown in Views 2 and 3.

Note at the left the clearance at the N.E. corner. This preceded the tunnel project and had nothing to do with same. The New York Steam Co. plant appears on 35th Street, between First Avenue and the East River.

Demolition of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church permitted this view and the steeple-less edifice is seen (in View 1) slightly to the east of Second Avenue.

View 1: May 26, 1939
Views 2-3: June 28, 1939

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, north side (buildings thereupon), west from Second Avenue, showing the Murray Hill Industrial High School, the New York Telephone Co. building and the Jarcho Brothers Warehouse.

To the left of the latter appears the upper portion of the dominant lo E. 40th Street Building. Above the school is the spired Chrysler Building.

The vacant lot shown at the S.W. corner will be excavated to provide the extrance site to the Midtown-Queens Tunnel under the East River. The Industrial High School was formerly P. S. 49.

July 23, 1939
Views: 1-2-3

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, north side (buildings thereupon), west from Second Avenue, showing the Murray Hill Industrial High School, the New York Telephone Co. building and the Jarcho Brothers Warehouse.

To the left of the latter appears the upper portion of the dominant lo E. 40th Street Building. Above the school is the spired Chrysler Building.

The vacant lot shown at the S.W. corner will be excavated to provide the extrance site to the Midtown-Queens Tunnel under the East River. The Industrial High School was formerly P. S. 49.

July 23, 1939
Views: 1-2-3

P. L. Sperr

East 37th Street, north side (buildings thereupon), west from Second Avenue, showing the Murray Hill Industrial High School, the New York Telephone Co. building and the Jarcho Brothers Warehouse.

To the left of the latter appears the upper portion of the dominant lo E. 40th Street Building. Above the school is the spired Chrysler Building.

The vacant lot shown at the S.W. corner will be excavated to provide the extrance site to the Midtown-Queens Tunnel under the East River. The Industrial High School was formerly P. S. 49.

July 23, 1939
Views: 1-2-3

P. L. Sperr

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue. The westerly pews of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church as viewed northward.

January 11, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue. A northward view down the center aisle of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church, showing pews on both sides of same and the organ loft overhead. The large stained glass window looks out over 37th Street and is directly over the entrance.

January 11, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue. The easterly half of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church as viewed northward from the alter rail. To the left appears the organ loft and the large stained window that is over the entrance.

January 11, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue. The west transept of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church.

January 11, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing the small passage way joining St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church with its parish house.

January 31, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing the parish house of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church. The Church is to the left, being joined by the small arch way shown. This will be demolished in June 1939.

January 25, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing the final stages of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church. This parish, established in 1860 is being demolished in the execution of plans for the plaza approach to the new Midtown Tunnel under the East River. Note the Parochial school to the rear.

May, 1939

George D. Chinn

(2) and (3)

Two westerly views of the same edifice slightly later. Here the photographer is viewing towards Second Avenue. Note in the distance the dimly outlined Empire State Building.

May 27, 1939
Views: 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing the final stages of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church. This parish, established in 1860 is being demolished in the execution of plans for the plaza approach to the new Midtown Tunnel under the East River. Note the Parochial school to the rear.

May, 1939

George D. Chinn

(2) and (3)

Two westerly views of the same edifice slightly later. Here the photographer is viewing towards Second Avenue. Note in the distance the dimly outlined Empire State Building.

May 27, 1939
Views: 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr

308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing the final stages of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church. This parish, established in 1860 is being demolished in the execution of plans for the plaza approach to the new Midtown Tunnel under the East River. Note the Parochial school to the rear.

May, 1939

George D. Chinn

(2) and (3)

Two westerly views of the same edifice slightly later. Here the photographer is viewing towards Second Avenue. Note in the distance the dimly outlined Empire State Building.

May 27, 1939
Views: 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr

E. 37th Street, west of Second Avenue, showing at the left buildings that will be completely gone in July 1939. This will extend to within 175 feet of Third Avenue and not include the B. Altman warehouse. To the right margin is the construction elevator necessitated by the New York Telephone Co. building addition.

January 8, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

view 1: 37th Street e. fr. nr. Second Avenue, showing construction of Queens Midtown Tunn el.

view 2: E. 37th Street e. fr. Second Avenue, showing New York Steam Plant, with tunnel construc- tion in foreground.

view 3: E. 37th Street, n.s., e. fr. Second Avenue, showing change in grade level.

P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 5, 1940

view 1: 37th Street e. fr. nr. Second Avenue, showing construction of Queens Midtown Tunn el.

view 2: E. 37th Street e. fr. Second Avenue, showing New York Steam Plant, with tunnel construc- tion in foreground.

view 3: E. 37th Street, n.s., e. fr. Second Avenue, showing change in grade level.

P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 5, 1940

view 1: 37th Street e. fr. nr. Second Avenue, showing construction of Queens Midtown Tunn el.

view 2: E. 37th Street e. fr. Second Avenue, showing New York Steam Plant, with tunnel construc- tion in foreground.

view 3: E. 37th Street, n.s., e. fr. Second Avenue, showing change in grade level.

P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 5, 1940

Rear of houses on 37th Street, east of Second Avenue.
P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 5, 1940

title: Second Avenue - 37th Street, northeast corner - looking north
